metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1805 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The (1) pipe_read and (2) pipe_write implementations in fs/pipe.c in the Linux kernel before 3.16 do not properly consider the side effects of failed __copy_to_user_inatomic and __copy_from_user_inatomic calls, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly gain privileges via a crafted application, aka an "I/O vector array overrun." A flaw was discovered in the user space memory copying for the pipe iovecs in the Linux kernel. An unprivileged local user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash) or potentially escalate their privileges.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1805` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:
